brief_summary.textblock:
To explore the effect of modified valsalva maneuver on the filling degree of right internal
      jugular vein.

      Method: The anteroposterior diameter and left-right diameter of right internal jugular vein
      in thirty adult gynecology patients were recorded during normal respiration and modified
      valsalva maneuver respectively.

      Investigators hypothesis that modified valsalva maneuver would enchance the filling degree
      of right internal jugular vein.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Modified Valsalva Maneuver on Filling Degree of Internal Jugular Vein
clinical_study.condition: the Filling of Jugular Vein Before Anesthesia With and Without Valsalva Maneuver

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

        - female patients age 18-60 years

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  heart or lung disease mental illness communication barriers.

study_pop.textblock:
female genecology patients, age 18-60 years old; weight 45-70 kg; body mass index (BMI)>20
        kg/m2 and <30 kg/m2; American Society of Anesthesiologists (ASA) grade I-II.

        The exclusion criteria were as follows: a history of chronic throat disease; upper
        respiratory tract infection within two weeks before surgery; and history of mental illness
        or communication barriers.

clinical_study.keyword: modified valsalva maneuver, internal jugular vein
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Modified Valsalva Maneuver on Filling Degree of Internal Jugular Vein

primary_outcome.measure: the change of the diameter of right internal jugular vein after modified valsalva maneuver

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Crossover, Time Perspective: Prospective
